body.directions: Read the phrases in Chinese, and then answer the question that follows.

body.quiz: What do the two characters in this word mean when broken down?
body.correct: You got it! 老lǎo means “old” and 师shī means “teacher.”
body.incorrect: Very close. Think about the “word dissection” for this word and check the meaning of the individual characters.

body.quiz: Which of the following words in the audio has the same social function as the word shown?
body.answer: Audio for 老师 lǎoshī
options: Audio for 再见 zàijiàn
Audio for 男孩 nánhái
Audio for 害羞 hàixiū
body.correct: Outstanding! The words 教授 jiàoshòu (professor) is a profession, while 老师 lǎoshī (teacher) is also a profession.
body.incorrect: Not quite. Think about what the word 老师 lǎoshī means and how it’s used in society.

body.quiz: Which of the following words share a same character in Chinese as the word shown?
body.correct: Terrific job! Both 医生 yīshēng (doctor) and 先生 xiānsheng (Mr.) have the character 生 shēng, which means “livelihood.”
body.incorrect: So close! Think about what each character means in this word, and which other word, when dissected, has the same character and meaning.

body.quiz: In which one of the following situations can the word shown be used?
body.answer: When greeting my grandfather at a family gathering
options: When hanging out with my friends
When discussing a math problem with my classmate
body.correct: How awesome! The word 您 nín ((formal) you) is used in formal settings to address people who are older or respected in society or family.
body.incorrect: So close! Think about what this word means and its social function. Check the vocabulary if you need to.
